metadata.title: Hopper Family Kentucky Locations
metadata.description: Kentucky locations connected to the Hopper family Presbyterian heritage

properties.name: Stanford Presbyterian Church
properties.description: Primary Hopper family church in Stanford, Kentucky. George Dunlap Hopper served as deacon and ruling elder here for many years. Site of 'Hopper Day' celebration in 1936 honoring Joseph Hopper.

properties.name: Perryville Presbyterian Church
events: Uncle Joe served as ruling elder (1854)
Uncle Joe served as clerk of session (1854-1875)
properties.description: Home church of 'Uncle Joe' Hopper, Kentucky evangelist. He was a member from 1851, ordained as ruling elder in 1854 at age 25, and served as clerk of session for over 20 years.

properties.name: Buffalo Cemetery
properties.description: Cemetery near Stanford where George Dunlap Hopper (1848-1913) and William M. Higgins were buried.
properties.geocoded_address: Buffalo Spring Cemetery, Stanford, Lincoln County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Perryville Cemetery
properties.description: Burial site of Joseph Hamilton 'Uncle Joe' Hopper (1829-1915), prominent Kentucky Presbyterian evangelist.
properties.geocoded_address: Perryville Springhill Cemetery, Perryville, Boyle County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Centre College
events: Joseph Hopper graduated magna cum laude (1914)
properties.description: Presbyterian college in Danville where multiple Hopper family members studied. Joseph Hopper graduated magna cum laude in 1914, his brother William graduated in 1908.
properties.geocoded_address: Centre College, Harding Street, West Danville, Danville, Boyle County, Kentucky, 40422, United States

properties.name: Louisville Presbyterian Theological Seminary
properties.description: Presbyterian seminary in Louisville where Joseph Hopper graduated in 1917, his brother William graduated in 1911, and Joseph's father-in-law Hershey Longenecker attended 1913-1916.
properties.geocoded_address: Louisville Presbyterian Theological Seminary, Chapel Valley Way, Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, 40205, United States

properties.name: Stanford, Kentucky
properties.description: Primary Hopper family town in Lincoln County. Joseph Hopper was born here in 1892. George Dunlap Hopper moved here in 1869 and farmed on the Danville pike at Hawkins' Branch.
properties.geocoded_address: Stanford, Lincoln County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Lancaster, Kentucky
properties.description: Birthplace of both Uncle Joe Hopper (1829) and George Dunlap Hopper (1848).
properties.geocoded_address: Lancaster, Garrard County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Perryville, Kentucky
properties.description: Home of Uncle Joe Hopper. He married Mary B. Mitchell, daughter of wealthy farmer from Boyle County, and lived in Perryville throughout his ministry.
properties.geocoded_address: Perryville, Boyle County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Highland Church, Louisville
events: Joseph Hopper served as stated supply (1919-1920)
properties.description: Louisville church where Joseph Hopper served as stated supply from 1919-1920 before departing for missionary work in Korea.
properties.geocoded_address: Highland Presbyterian Church, 1001, Cherokee Road, Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, 40204, United States

properties.name: Maxwell Street Presbyterian Church, Lexington
properties.description: Lexington church where Margaret Higgins Hopper was a member before becoming a missionary to Korea.
properties.geocoded_address: Maxwell Street Presbyterian Church, Lexington Avenue, Academic Core, University of Kentucky, Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, 40508, United States

properties.name: Woodland Presbyterian Church, Louisville
properties.description: Louisville church where William Higgins Hopper served as pastor.

properties.name: Flora Heights Presbyterian Church, Louisville
properties.description: Louisville church where William Higgins Hopper served as pastor.

properties.name: Twin Creek Church, Athol
properties.description: Mountain church in Breathitt County where Joseph Hopper was installed as pastor in 1917, part of his early ministry in eastern Kentucky.
properties.geocoded_address: Shoulderblade-Guerrant-Athol Road, Copebranch, Breathitt County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Canyon Falls Church
properties.description: Church where Joseph Hopper was installed as pastor in 1917, part of his early Kentucky ministry.
properties.geocoded_address: Canyon Falls, Lee County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: St. Helens Church
properties.description: Church where Joseph Hopper was installed as pastor in 1917, part of his early Kentucky ministry.
properties.geocoded_address: Saint Helens, Lee County, Kentucky, 41311, United States

properties.name: Berry Boulevard Church, Louisville
events: Hershey Longenecker served as stated supply/pastor (1915-1917)
properties.description: Louisville church where Hershey Longenecker (Joseph Hopper's father-in-law) served as stated supply and pastor from 1915-1917.

properties.name: First Presbyterian Church, Louisville
events: Edward O. Guerrant served before becoming evangelist
properties.description: Historic Louisville church where Edward O. Guerrant served before beginning his mountain mission work, which Uncle Joe Hopper later joined.
properties.geocoded_address: First Cumberland Presbyterian Church, 4610, Manslick Road, Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, 40216, United States

properties.name: First Presbyterian Church, Danville
properties.description: Danville church where Uncle Joe Hopper was briefly a member.
properties.geocoded_address: First Presbyterian Church, 500, West Main Street, West Danville, Danville, Boyle County, Kentucky, 40442, United States

properties.name: Burnside, Kentucky
properties.description: Town in Pulaski County where William Higgins Hopper served as pastor.
properties.geocoded_address: Burnside, Pulaski County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Stanford Female College
properties.description: Women's college in Stanford where Margaret Higgins Hopper studied from 1900-1904.

properties.name: Sayre College, Lexington
properties.description: Lexington educational institution where Margaret Higgins Hopper studied.
properties.geocoded_address: Sayre School, 194, North Limestone, Central Business District, Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, 40507, United States

properties.name: Stanford High School
properties.description: High school in Stanford where Margaret Higgins Hopper taught for over 30 years, from 1909 to 1941.

properties.name: Mt. Sterling, Kentucky
events: Walter Hopper served as high school superintendent
properties.description: Town in Montgomery County where Walter Owsley Hopper served as superintendent of the high school.
properties.geocoded_address: Mount Sterling, Montgomery County, Kentucky, 40353, United States

properties.name: Harrodsburg, Kentucky
events: Evangelistic meetings held by Uncle Joe
properties.description: Site of evangelistic meetings conducted by Uncle Joe Hopper during his ministry throughout Kentucky.
properties.geocoded_address: Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, 40330, United States

properties.name: Salvisa, Kentucky
events: Church organized by Guerrant and Uncle Joe
properties.description: Church organized by Edward O. Guerrant and Uncle Joe Hopper during their evangelistic work.
properties.geocoded_address: Salvisa, Mercer County, Kentucky, 40372, United States

properties.name: Hazel Green, Wolfe County
properties.description: Mountain town in Wolfe County where a Presbyterian church was organized in 1896 through Uncle Joe's evangelistic work.
properties.geocoded_address: Hazel Green, Wolfe County, Kentucky, 41332, United States

properties.name: Somerset, Kentucky
properties.description: Town where Uncle Joe Hopper conducted evangelistic work.
properties.geocoded_address: Somerset, Pulaski County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Lawrenceburg, Kentucky
properties.description: Town where Uncle Joe Hopper conducted evangelistic work.
properties.geocoded_address: Lawrenceburg, Anderson County, Kentucky, 40342, United States

properties.name: Scottsville, Allen County
properties.description: Town in Allen County where a church was organized through Uncle Joe's evangelistic ministry.
properties.geocoded_address: Scottsville, Allen County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Corbin, Kentucky
properties.description: Town where Joseph Hopper preached during his early Kentucky ministry.
properties.geocoded_address: Corbin, Whitley County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Heidelburg, Lee County
events: Built Beechwood Seminary mission school building (1911)
properties.description: Mountain village in Lee County where Hershey Longenecker and his brother Elmer built the Beechwood Seminary mission school building for Dr. Guerrant's Soul Winners Society.
properties.geocoded_address: Heidelberg, Lee County, Kentucky, 41333, United States

properties.name: Beechwood Seminary, Heidelburg
properties.description: Presbyterian mission school in the mountains of Lee County built by Hershey Longenecker. His brother Elmer remained as principal after construction was complete.

properties.name: Stearns, Kentucky
properties.description: Mining town where the Presbytery of Transylvania sent Hershey Longenecker to preach before he entered Louisville Presbyterian Seminary.
properties.geocoded_address: Stearns, McCreary County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Rousseau, Quicksand Creek
events: Preached, taught school, lived in rough house beside church
properties.description: Remote mountain location on Quicksand Creek, 16 miles from the railroad, where Hershey Longenecker lived in a roughly built house beside the church, preaching and teaching a little school during the winter.
properties.geocoded_address: Quicksand, Breathitt County, Kentucky, 41339, United States

properties.name: Walnut Branch, Lincoln County
properties.description: Location in Lincoln County where William M. Higgins (1820-1894) was buried in the McRoberts Cemetery. He was the father of Katherine E. Higgins Hopper.
properties.geocoded_address: Walnut Flat, Lincoln County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Knox County, Kentucky
properties.description: Burial location of Joseph Hopper (1782-1860), grandfather of George Dunlap Hopper. He died in Lancaster, Garrard County and was buried in Knox County.
properties.geocoded_address: Knox County, Kentucky, United States

properties.name: Danville, Lincoln County
properties.description: Location where Joseph Hopper (1782-1860) married Margaret Crowe on March 3, 1817.
